headline: Kroger blames Albertsons for merger's demise in new court filings
summary: Kroger is denying Albertsons’ claims that it didn’t do enough to ensure regulatory approval of the companies’ planned supermarket merger.  In court papers filed Tuesday in the Delaware Court of Chancery, Kroger said Albertsons disregarded the companies’ merger agreement and worked secretly with a partner, C&S Wholesalers, to try to force Kroger to divest more stores to C&S.  Kroger also claimed that Albertsons was secretly planning to sue Kroger if the deal didn’t go through long before the merger actually fell apart in December.

Kroger also claimed that Albertsons was secretly planning to sue Kroger if the deal didn’t go through long before the merger actually fell apart in December.

headline: Kroger Accuses Albertsons of Undermining Their $20 Billion Merger
summary: Three months after Boise-based Albertsons sued Kroger over their collapsed deal, Kroger has hit back in court.  Kroger denied Albertsons’ claims that it didn’t do enough to secure regulatory approval for their failed $20 billion deal and accused its former merger partner of undermining its efforts.  In a Delaware state court filing unsealed Tuesday, Kroger said Albertsons improperly worked with C&S Wholesale Grocers to inflate the number of stores that needed to be divested.

headline: Kroger Files Legal Response, Brings Counterclaims Against Albertsons
summary: The Kroger Co. (NYSE: KR) today announced that it has filed its answer and counterclaims to the complaint brought by Albertsons in the Delaware Court of Chancery, in connection with the previous merger agreement between the two companies, which was terminated in December 2024.

headline: 5 Warren Buffett Stocks Hit All-Time Highs Over the Past Month While the Market Fell. Here's the Best of the Bunch.
summary: Most investors probably haven't enjoyed the last few weeks as major stock indexes plunged.  The legendary investor has watched shares of his Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) (NYSE: BRK.B) soar this year.  Berkshire Hathaway itself stands atop the list of Buffett stocks that have reached a record high recently.
